abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Guanzhong Irrigation
            Improvement Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            highly satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low
            or negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was highly satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the key lessons from this project
            are that genuine Water Resource Management (WRM) reforms
            will be successfully delivered if: (i) there is a strong
            enabling policy, regulatory and legal framework; (ii) strong
            political commitment to the reform process and the will to
            overcome the resistance to reforms that will emerge; (iii)
            any reform package should include a combination of
            government institutional reforms or top down measures and
            bottom up reform measures involving water users. This
            combined approach should be focused on participatory
            irrigation management by creating and strengthening the
            relationship between the water service providers and the
            water users through Water User Association (WUAs).
            Professional leadership and management by Project Management
            Offices (PMOs) at all levels is a key success factor, as is
            the careful selection and continuity of appointment of PMO
            staff at all levels. The Bank's supervision strategy
            was built around using this capacity within the
            borrower's project management organizations and
            institutions and effectively using the monitoring and
            evaluation system established through an independent third
            party, thus developing trust and credibility between the
            Bank and the borrower.

5084503.trustfund:
TF036227-CHINA - GUANZHONG IRRIGATION
            IMPROVEMENT PROJECT,TF039847-CHINA - GUANZHONG IRRIGATION
            IMPROVEMENT PROJECT,TF039762-CHINA-GUANZHONG IRRIGATION
            IMPROVEMENT PROJECT,TF025385-PHRD-GUANZHONG IRRIGATION
            IMPROVEMENT PROJ.(REC-EXEC),TF025099-PHRD-GUANZHONG IRRIGATION IMPROVE.PROJ.(BANK-EXEC),TF030451-AUSTRALIA CTF FY04: EAP, AFRICA
            & GLOBAL (WATER, SANITATION,& FLOOD PRO,TF036246-CHINA - GUANZHONG IRRIGATION
            IMPROVEMENT PROJECT
5084503.majtheme: Public sector governance,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development

abstracts.cdata!:
The Guanzhong Irrigation Improvement
            Project aims to improve the existing irrigation systems in
            Guanzhong Plain of Shaanxi Province and thereby raise
            agricultural production and farm incomes. There are eight
            project components. 1) Improvement and expansion of water
            source will improve the existing nine irrigation areas and
            develop some tracts of land. 2) Improvement of major
            distribution system will support repair and completion of
            concrete panels or masonry lining in main and branch canals.
            3) The component will support rehabilitation of pumping
            stations in six irrigation districts (IDs). 4) This
            component will improve the existing minor canals, drains,
            and on-farm development works on partially irrigated land,
            and expand new systems to land that currently has no
            irrigation distribution network at the lateral level. 5)
            Improvement of operation and maintenance will improve access
            roads to key infrastructure works and renovate management
            stations and research facilities. 6) Training, study tours,
            and technical assistance will improve the knowledge and
            understanding of resources. 6) Project management
            arrangements will ensure good coordination between
            government bureaus and irrigation districts associated with
            project implementation. 7) This component will supervise IDs
            in finalizing the designs for the canal improvement works.
            8) The component will facilitate land acquisition to
            accommodate enlarged storage facilities and relocate the
            people affected.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Guanzhong Irrigation Improvement
            Project consists of water diversion junction engineering
            structures, irrigation canals, a pumping station, drainage,
            water resource works, as well as medium-low yield farmland
            and infrastructure facilities in the districts of Baojixia,
            Junghuiqu, Jiaokou, Taoqupo, Shitouhe, Fengjiashan,
            Yangmawan, Luohuiqu, and Shibuchuan. The favorable impact
            upon the environment from this project is in agriculture
            with the improvement in irrigation efficiency and multiple
            croping indexes. The major unfavorable impacts and
            mitigation measures follow. The construction of resource
            engineering will inundate a part of cultivated farmland and
            necessitate the removal of some local inhabitants -
            mitigated by a careful resettlement plan. An increase in
            dust, waste water, debris, and noise will occur during the
            construction phase. An increase in the amount of water
            diversion in the irrigation districts will slightly
            encourage the occurrence frequency of thermophicic
            agro-diseases and pests. One suggestion included states that
            after the completion of the project, long -term environment
            monitoring and observation should be made of the areas affected.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Shaanxi Guanzhong Irrigation
            Distric Upgrading Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan concerns
            several subprojects of the Shaanxi Guanzhong Irrigation
            District Upgrading Project involving land acquisition and
            resettlement due to reservoir and irrigation ditch creation.
            The report looks at the principle of resettlement planning,
            the legal framework, results of a social and economic
            survey, loss estimates and compensation, relocation
            (including production arrangements), compensation cost
            estimates, implementation schedules, organization of
            resettlement, and risk analysis. The report concludes with a
            resettlement action plan for the Gan River Reservoir
            Dam-adding project as well as the Louhui Ditch Headwork dam
            -adding and floodgate adding project at Baojixia Irrigation District.
